column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Handle an Aggressive Child
#Text=If a child repeatedly acts aggressively , you might wonder “ What am I doing wrong ? ”
#Text=Instead of getting down on yourself about a child 's tendency to shout , hit , or push , use the problem as a benchmark for teaching the child more appropriate ways to behave .
#Text=Be sure not to respond to their aggression with your own .
#Text=Keep your cool and show the child how to problem-solve common situations and express themselves using assertiveness .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Reacting to Aggression
#Text=Stay calm .
#Text=Resist the urge to behave aggressively yourself .
#Text=Take a few deep breaths or silently count to 10 to maintain your composure .
#Text=When you are in control of your own emotional reaction , the child can look to your example for managing tough situations .
#Text=Remove the child from the environment .
#Text=Break aggressive behaviors by making the child leave the situation .
#Text=For example , if they are playing rough with siblings , make them take a timeout .
#Text=If they act up in the grocery store , leave .
#Text=If you 're shopping with a companion , have that person escort them outside .
#Text=If the child purposefully uses aggression to get out of undesirable activities or situations , use another approach .
#Text=Do n't allow them to leave .
#Text=Do n’t spank the child .
#Text=Because you 're trying to instill the idea that aggression is n't the solution , avoid spanking an aggressive child .
#Text=Instead , use consequences that help them actually learn from their mistakes and inspire better behavior in the future .
#Text=For instance , you might have the aggressive child repeat writing a sentence , like “ I will not push in line .
#Text=I will keep my hands to myself and wait until my turn . ”
#Text=Set clear limits and adhere to clear consequences .
#Text=Be sure the child knows what 's expected of them by explaining the rules .
#Text=Post them in a common area , such as on the refrigerator or in the common room .
#Text=When the child breaks a rule , calmly state what they did wrong and the consequence for their acting out .
#Text=Say something like , “ We do n't kick one another , Bryan .
#Text=Because you kicked your brother , you wo n't be allowed to finish watching the show .
#Text=Go to your room and read a book . ”
#Text=Be consistent with discipline .
#Text=Across situations and caregivers , it 's important to maintain consistency .
#Text=Do n't overlook aggressive behaviors at home , but discipline the child when they occur in public .
#Text=Similarly , if one parent sets a rule or consequences for aggression , the other parent needs to get on board also .
#Text=If you do n't consistently stop and address aggressive behavior , the child wo n't be motivated ( or reminded ) to change it .
#Text=Take a timeout to regulate your own emotions if the child hurts you .
#Text=If you get caught in the middle of the child 's aggression , take a moment to take care of yourself .
#Text=Tell the child " Ow , you hurt me ! I will talk to you once I 've calmed down .
